improvements: Increase exposure by +0.7 to +1.0 stop to make the grey-looking snow appear truly white
Crop the top 15% of the frame to remove the distracting fence, sign, and background figures
Increase clarity by +10 to +15 to enhance the definition of the dog's fur texture
Slightly warm the white balance (move temperature slider towards yellow) to reduce blue casts in the shadows
critiques.notes: The photograph features excellent focus and action, but the camera's light meter has underexposed the scene, turning the bright snow grey. Correcting the exposure and removing background clutter will make the main subject pop.

improvements: Crop ~15% from the right edge and ~10% from the top to remove the bright sign and tighten focus on the main dog while keeping the background dog visible.
Reduce highlights in the snow/white fur by ~20% and lift shadows by ~10% to recover detail and balance contrast.
Add a local adjustment on the main dog's face: increase texture/clarity by ~10% and sharpen by ~15% (mask to fur/eyes only) to enhance subject definition.
Slightly cool the white balance (about -300K) and reduce yellow saturation by ~5% to keep the snow and fur looking cleaner and more neutral.
critiques.notes: Strong moment and engaging subject with good low-angle perspective and pleasant background separation. The main distractions are the bright sign and slightly blown/flat whites in the snow and fur; targeted cropping and tonal control will improve focus and detail.
